TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Currency extends Android.Icu.Util.MeasureUnit

Docs.summary: A class encapsulating a currency, as defined by ISO 4217.

remarks.para:
A class encapsulating a currency, as defined by ISO 4217. A Currency object can be created given a Locale or given an ISO 4217 code. Once created, the Currency object can return various data necessary to its proper display:
  • A display symbol, for a specific locale
  • The number of fraction digits to display
  • A rounding increment
The DecimalFormat class uses these data to display currencies.
Note: This class deliberately resembles java.util.Currency but it has a completely independent implementation, and adds features not present in the JDK.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the set of available currencies.
Docs.value: The set of available currencies. The returned set could be empty if there is no currency data available.

remarks.para: Returns the set of available currencies. The returned set of currencies contains all of the available currencies, including obsolete ones. The result set can be modified without affecting the available currencies in the runtime.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the ISO 4217 3-letter code for this currency object.

remarks.para: Returns the ISO 4217 3-letter code for this currency object.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the number of the number of fraction digits that should be displayed for this currency.
Docs.value: a non-negative number of fraction digits to be displayed

remarks.para: Important: The number of fraction digits for a given currency is NOT guaranteed to be constant across versions of ICU or CLDR. For example, do NOT use this value as a mechanism for deciding the magnitude used to store currency values in a database. You should use this value for display purposes only.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the display name for this currency in the default locale.
Docs.value: The display name of this currency

remarks.para: Returns the display name for this currency in the default locale. If the resource data for the default locale contains no entry for this currency, then the ISO 4217 code is returned.
Note: This method is a convenience equivalent for java.util.Currency#getDisplayName() and is equivalent to getName(Locale.getDefault(), LONG_NAME, null).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string[]? GetKeywordValuesForLocale (string? key, Android.Icu.Util.ULocale? locale, bool commonlyUsed);
.method public static hidebysig string[] GetKeywordValuesForLocale(string key, class Android.Icu.Util.ULocale locale, bool commonlyUsed) cil managed
static member GetKeywordValuesForLocale : string * Android.Icu.Util.ULocale * bool -> string[]

Docs.param: key whose values to look up. the only recognized key is "currency"
the locale
if true, return only values that are currently used in the locale. Otherwise returns all values.
Docs.summary: Given a key and a locale, returns an array of values for the key for which data exists.
Docs.returns: an array of values for the given key and the locale. If there is no data, the array will be empty.

remarks.para: Given a key and a locale, returns an array of values for the key for which data exists. If commonlyUsed is true, these are the values that typically are used with this locale, otherwise these are all values for which data exists. This is a common service API.
The only supported key is "currency", other values return an empty array.
Currency information is based on the region of the locale. If the locale does not indicate a region, ULocale#addLikelySubtags(ULocale) is used to infer a region, except for the 'und' locale.

If commonlyUsed is true, only the currencies known to be in use as of the current date are returned. When there are more than one, these are returned in preference order (typically, this occurs when a country is transitioning to a new currency, and the newer currency is preferred), see Unicode TR#35 Sec. C1. If commonlyUsed is false, all currencies ever used in any locale are returned, in no particular order.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

remarks.para: Returns the display name for the given currency in the given locale. For example, the display name for the USD currency object in the en_US locale is "$".

abstract member GetName : Android.Icu.Util.ULocale * Android.Icu.Util.CurrencyNameStyle * string * bool[] -> string override this.GetName : Android.Icu.Util.ULocale * Android.Icu.Util.CurrencyNameStyle * string * bool[] -> string

Docs.param: locale in which to display currency
selector for which kind of name to return
plural count string for this locale
Docs.summary: Returns the display name for the given currency in the given locale.
Docs.returns: display string for this currency. If the resource data contains no entry for this currency, then the ISO 4217 code is returned.

remarks.para: Returns the display name for the given currency in the given locale. For example, the SYMBOL_NAME for the USD currency object in the en_US locale is "$". The PLURAL_LONG_NAME for the USD currency object when the currency amount is plural is "US dollars", such as in "3.00 US dollars"; while the PLURAL_LONG_NAME for the USD currency object when the currency amount is singular is "US dollar", such as in "1.00 US dollar".

format.a: Java documentation for android.icu.util.Currency.getName(android.icu.util.ULocale, int, java.lang.String, boolean[]).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool IsAvailable (string? code, Java.Util.Date? from, Java.Util.Date? to);
.method public static hidebysig bool IsAvailable(string code, class Java.Util.Date from, class Java.Util.Date to) cil managed
static member IsAvailable : string * Java.Util.Date * Java.Util.Date -> bool

Docs.param: The ISO 4217 3-letter code.
The lower bound of the date range, inclusive. When from is null, check the availability of the currency any date before to
The upper bound of the date range, inclusive. When to is null, check the availability of the currency any date after from
Docs.summary: Queries if the given ISO 4217 3-letter code is available on the specified date range.
Docs.returns: true if the given ISO 4217 3-letter code is supported on the specified date range.

remarks.para: Queries if the given ISO 4217 3-letter code is available on the specified date range.

Note: For checking availability of a currency on a specific date, specify the date on both from and to. When both from and to are null, this method checks if the specified currency is available all time.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
